_meanings:
{@--4@} To cast 
oneself at, throw oneself down; {#mayi te#}
{#pAdapatite kiMkaratvamupAgate#} <ls>Pt. 4. 7</ls>; so
{#caraRapatitaM#} <ls>Me. 105.</ls>

{@--11@} To fall to one's lot or
share.
{@--12@} To be in, fall in or into.
({#pAtayati-te, patayati#} rarely).

{@--2@} To let
fall, throw or drop down, fell down
(as trees &c.).

{@--3@} To ruin, 
overthrow; <ls>Ś. 5. 21.</ls>

{@--4@} To shed (as
tears).

{@--5@} To cast, direct (as the
sight).
{@--6@} To dash or strike out.

{@--7@}
To throw or put in, cause to enter.
{@--8@} To bring to ruin or misfortune.

{@--10@} (In <ab>Arith.</ab>) To subtract,
deduct.

{@--11@} To set in motion, set
on foot.
To wish to fall.
<ab>Ved.</ab>
{@--1@} To be master of.

{@--2@} To rule,
control.
{@--3@} To possess.

{@--4@} To be fit
for, serve for (with <ab>dat.</ab>)
{@--1@} To go, move.
{@--2@} To be master of (intransitive).
